turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Buzz, Mr. Kastle wants to talk to you.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Are you guys bruddas?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Look, Faz, Mr. Kastle was not his usual charismatic self today when he told us to tell you...  What was that he said...?

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: I remember, Sid! Mr. Kastle says he don't like no sticky fingers in the till.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Pinhead! Don't just blurt it right out.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Your pop said to put these on his tab. Sid gets up and jerks his thumb towards the door.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: So Buzz, let's skedaddle. Mr. Kastle is waiting. As Buzz gets up, Theo rises and steps between his father and the two sleazeballs.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Bowling used to be so pure, so...All- American. Breeze sings along with Caruso and pretends to conduct.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: La da da dalala...

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: I hate fuckin' opera.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: How could you hate opera, Sid? Opera has all the drama and excitement of real life - to music!

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: How do you know, you don't even speak Latin?

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: You listen to the feelings, not the words.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: You got an 8-track tape player on purpose, just 'cause you knew the only thing they had on 8-track was fuckin' opera.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: It was a clearance.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: You know, Elvis bowled.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: No kiddin'.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Bowling was the most incorruptible sport. No megalomillionaires, no

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: gambling. And it was a safe place for kids, a place where the whole community could meet for some wholesome, clean fun.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Sure, Sid.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: But not no more. Now people take advantage. Bowling ain't what it used to be. There's something evil spreading in this sport - like a big, gigantic, puss- ridden -

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: - canker sore.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Right, eating at the core, eating it's way out. It makes me sick!

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: How do you turn this thing off?

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Wait! That's an aria!

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Hello Mr. Kastle.  Junior, long time. I thought they locked you up and threw away the warden!

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Is it true they blacked out the whole county giving you electro-shock? Junior looks from one man to the other, breathing heavily, his nostrils flaring.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Bowling police, step back, give him room.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Nothing going on here, everybody stand back. Let him through, ladies. Ladies, please. As they start to move through the female throng, a little girl pops out in front of them, holding her ball.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Did you know you were parked in the handicap space?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Kastle's daughter's been lookin' for you.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: She told us you went after Junior to save your old man's hide. You got some balls goin' after that psycho.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Only problem is, you didn't put his lights out, you just got him mad. Then he took it out on poor Faz, God rest his soul. Theo patches out.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Think he bought it?

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: I'd buy it!

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: The Faz sure took care a her.  Breeze makes a nasal GRUNT as he tries to suppress a snigger. Sid - trying to keep a straight face - elbows him. Sid and Breeze approach the coffin. Breeze pulls an orange whip out of a paper bag and carefully places it on the coffin lid.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Nectar of the bowling gods, Faz.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: See ya 'round Faz.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Yeah, and make it extra muddy, I didn't sleep a zee last night. Sheila fills a cup. Buzz lifts it to his mouth, his hands trembling.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You don't need coffee, Mr. Fazeli; you need a vacation. Sheila catches sight of Theo pulling into the parking lot. She puts a Ken head earring in her right ear. Buzz follows Sheila's gaze.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Some people will do anything for an autograph. Theo enters the diner and walks over to Buzz.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Buzz Burger, side of 'cues. You haven't introduced me to your fan.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Sheila, meet...uh...  I forget the name.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You look like you're something on the lanes.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Theo's bowled on the tour.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Oh, a professional man. What'll you have?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: What's on your mind, Miles?

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: We've been partners a long time now, haven't we Buzz?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Seven years.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: This scam we got going here was your

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: brainstorm, Buzz. I admit, I thought it was a rotten idea, but I put up the scratch.  And now we got a beautiful thing.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: It's a beautiful thing.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: A beautiful thing. And you know why Buzz? You know what we got? Buzz raises an eyebrow as he buttons his shirt.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: And look at that; both partners go down together. Kastle shoves the sculpture onto the floor, stands up, and crushes it under his heel. He goes over and puts his arm around Buzz.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Simple math, Buzz.  Two plus two does not equal three.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Miles, I've always been on the square with you.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: I'm sure you have Buzz.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Wish me luck.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Buzz Fazeli.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Theo.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I know your face, you're an up-and-comer. You bowl on the tour.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm not on the tour this year.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Need some advice, huh.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Well, Mr. Fazeli, the Bowling Congress says I'm a thorn in their side.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Don't worry about the Congress, they're just a bunch of moralistic busy-bodies.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I got suspended when I was young, too. I was pretty cocky in my day.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: They suspended me for 100 years.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: 100 years!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I can appeal in five. I was hoping you could help me Mr. Fazeli.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: What do you think I can do?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I need a sponsor to get my sanction card back. Where I come from, you're the king.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Sure, around here, any fat old bald guy could be king. I'm nothing. It wouldn't do any good for me to talk to the Congress.  Hey, you thirsty? You like orange whips?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I've never had orange whips, I'm from Akron.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Remember the finals in Akron in '59? You had a seven-ten split in the final frame.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Yeah, against that prick VanDeMark.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Ten thousand to one, but you pegged it. The toughest shot on the last frame.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: That game was before you was born.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: My mom was there. She told me about it. The 'Fazeli Split.'

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Orange whip, nectar of the bowling gods. Thanks sweetie. Millie turns the tray so that Buzz takes the untainted whip.  Theo takes the other glass.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Where'd you get this ball?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It's mine.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Who gave it to you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Grace Skinner.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Grace Skinner. Who's Grace Skinner to you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: She's my mom.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Who are you? Who sent you here?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm your son. You're a hard father to find.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I don't know no Grace Skinner.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You knew her. You married her in 1963.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: You're a bullshit artist, that's what you are. You got no right to be here! Theo yanks the trophy away from Buzz.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I got a right. You're my father.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I ain't nobody's father!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Millie left to stay with her sister in Ronkonkoma.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: You know what a mixer ball is? It's like you, you come out of nowhere and upset things, scattering everything all over. Buzz grumpily waves at him to sit.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What are you doing over at the lanes that's so dangerous, Buzz?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: You shouldn't listen to her, she's a nervous old Nellie.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: She thinks someone's trying to kill you.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I couldn't pay someone enough to try to kill me. Sheila comes over to take their orders.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Theo.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Theo! This is Sheila Kastle, my partner's daughter.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Watch out for that one. She's got a great average, but she's looking for a prince. And, believe me, she's

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: kissed a lotta tadpoles.  Listen, I been thinking about your problem. I'm not the guy to sponsor you. It would be unethical. But, there is something I could do for you.  Putt-putt golf.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Putt-putt golf?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: It's the next level, the next dimension...  ...the small ball.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: The small ball.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: It's gonna be bigger than big. Think Europe. Think Asia. They don't have room for real golf courses in Japan.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Not for me. Miniature golf's for pansies.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: If the Japanese are pansies, then pansies are my kind of people. Sheila steps over to the booth with their food. The Buzz Burger has three holes cut in the middle to make it look like a bowling ball. Buzz sees the two sleazeballs park their car and walk towards the diner.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Maybe I could bowl in Japan.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What the fuck is this?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: What's it look like to you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It looks like dwarf bowling.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I do what I gotta do to survive.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You have no right to call yourself a bowler. Buzz slaps Theo in the face.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I'm more of a bowler than you'll ever be. I deal with my own shit. I ain't asking anyone to bail me out.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm your blood.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: You wish!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: What makes you so sure it was me? She coulda had lotsa bowlers! Theo rushes Buzz and grabs his arm. The two men struggle for the pin.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Don't say that about my mom!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I had a career. She wanted a little bowler of her own. Sid and Breeze leap into the fray, prying the two men apart. They wrestle Theo against a wall, pressing his face into the tiles.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Fuck you and fuck bowling.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: That's a laugh. You're all strung out. You're a bowling junkie.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't need the stinking pro-tour.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: You're dead without the pro-tour, and you know it. Get him away from me. Sid and Breeze punch Theo in the face.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Theo, I want you to get out of this town.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm getting to like it here.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Did that porcupine say he'd get you back on the tour?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I gotta survive.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: He'll be a barnacle on your ass the rest of your life.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You got a better offer?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I didn't think so.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Not for somebody who hit a man with his ball on national television.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That's right, Buzz, and you know when I did it? Last match, last frame. All I needed was one spare for the crown - and I get stuck with the seven-ten, the Fazeli Split.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: You never even took the shot. You couldn't do it. Theo moves towards Buzz in a threatening manner.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I was beaten on a shot named after my own dad. The moment passes. Theo turns and climbs into his car. He looks up at Buzz.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Look, kid, gimme a break. I'm an old man.  I'm runnin' on a Delrin aorta. I'm finished - dead from my ankles up.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I couldn't care less.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: We ain't married no more.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: He says that to all his wives.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: The whole world thinks you're underground.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I am underground.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It could just as easily have been me in that box.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I told you to get lost. You forced yourself into this mess, so the mess accommodated you. Buzz straightens out and carefully remolds the bent out of shape halo.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What about bowling?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Bowling died for me years ago. Besides, I'm a living dead legend. I'm a hero.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You're a scumbag.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: So, eh, you never saw me. Right?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I never saw you.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Thanks, kid.  Where are you goin' now?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm goin' straight. No more short cuts. Theo gets into the car. Buzz leans in the open window.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Listen, if straight doesn't work out, you come work for me.  Just make sure nobody's following you. Buzz's face is eerily lit by the glow of the sunset, his halo bouncing in the breeze.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I didn't mean that stuff I said. I was trying to keep you out of this muddle. I'm glad I didn't have my tubes tied. Oh, and by the way, I made a call for you before I - uh - retired. Buzz takes his card and scrawl on the back with a gold pen.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: You give Ed Klein of the American Bowling Congress a call.  Tell him your Maynard's boy. He's expecting you, and he owes me. He'll getcha back in like Flynn.  Don't say I never gave you nothing.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: See ya 'round Maynard.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: Oh sure. Let everyone in. From now on I leave the door wide open. Let the parade begin!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Clam it!

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: He's the guy Buzz.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: He's not the guy, Millie. Just whip the whips.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: I looked in his car. He's got pictures of you, clippings, maps.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Bowlers don't go around killing other bowlers. He's only a fan, Millie. I'll give him some tips and an autograph and he's outta here.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: You're in trouble, aren't you Buzz? You're doing something dangerous in that alley.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Millie, I know what I'm doing.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: We should leave this town. I can't take this anymore. I'm not gonna let him kill you in my house.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: Son?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Millie, please.  I don't have a son. I think you better leave now young man. Buzz gestures towards the front door.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: My poor baby!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: You see what you did?  Take your ball and get out.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Hello, mom?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Theodore? Where are you? Are you alright?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I found dad.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: He's dead, isn't he.  Buzz Fazeli might just as well have died before you were born.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Mom, you know I had to do it. I just did it a little too late.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You sure you're OK Teddy? You're not bowling are you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I gotta go. Love ya mom.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Don't tell me, John.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Cool!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Theo. Howzitgoin.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Hey man, welcome to our parking lot. Lemme give you some advice, if she asks you to dance, make sure her brother's not around. Somebody blew out Junior's pilot light, if you get my meaning.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: How's that?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I was doing the lambada with her and the guy freaks, he breaks my arm, tries to kill me. I swear man, the guy thought I was a piata. If nobody else hadn't a been there, he wouldn't have stopped. He woulda killed me. Fuckin' guy man, just snapped. How do you like your burger?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Uh...over easy.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'll tell you one thing, you won't see me around that alley with that freak on the loose. Stay away from his ass - and don't play any of his fuckin' knock-knock jokes.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't like to talk about it.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: You're prone to violent outbursts, aren't you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It depends.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: It feels good to let it out, doesn't it? Sheila leans over and whispers furiously to her father.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Knock-knock.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Who's there?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Who's there!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Buzz Fazeli.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: NO. I SAY KNOCK-KNOCK! You say who's there. I say who's there and then you say who who. You're not playing right.  Knock-knock.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Who's there?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: JUNIOR!  You're supposed to say JUNIOR WHO! I'm going to have to hurt you. Theo and Junior circle one another.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: You shouldn't touch her.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: No, Junior, you shouldn't touch her.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Nobody touches her. Except me. I touch her. Sheila told me you played bouncy- bouncy with her.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What did your dad tell you to do to Buzz? Theo scrambles up the lane on hands and knees. Junior catches him, grabbing his ankles.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: He told me to play Blue-Face with Buzz. I like games.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What did you do to Buzz?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: You played bouncy-bouncy with Sheila, so I'm gonna play Blue-Face with you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't want to play.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: It's not so bad. When I'm alone, it feels like someone else. Sheila grabs the bottle from Junior, opens it and pours some on her shish kebab. She leans over and whispers furiously to her father.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Do you have to get your hooks into every guy I'm interested in?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Come on Sheila, knock-knock.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Who's there?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Junior.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Junior who?

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: J'you-and-your-friend do it yet?

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Junior's a problem child. He has a thing about -

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: SHEILA!

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Come on, Junior. Everyone's waiting for you, son. The beam of light catches Junior's face. He is crouched inside the machine at lane six. Jr. His face is cut and bleeding and his straitjacket torn and filthy.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Needs lubrication. Lubrication.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: We're having a party for you, boy. Cake and shish-k-bob, just like you love. Junior cringes away from the light.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: You made me hurt him!

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: I have someone for you to play with Junior.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Someone wants to play with me?

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: I have someone for you to play Blueface with Junior.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Blueface! Blueface is my favorite.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Weird, comes into alleys and doesn't bowl.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: It's not an "Alley". I hate when people call it a "Bowling Alley", it's so common! I prefer "Bowling Center".

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Someone gonna get kacked, boss?

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: If I find out Buzz is comin' up short on dwarf bowling, it's lights out for him and pink slips for you. Sid and Breeze look sideways at each other.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Hey, enough fun and games. We have work to do. Come on Junior. Kastle heads for his car. Junior gets up and follows. The two sleazeballs tarry as Theo stands.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: If Junior thinks you're doing the bouncy- bouncy with his sister, he's gonna tap dance on your spleen.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Buzz has been moving the cash out in hollow bowling pins. Sid and Breeze throw sideways glances at each other.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: I want you two to pick up Buzz and bring him to lane six. Junior will take it from there.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: So you're Buzz's boy. I've been expecting you. You hurt my feelings when you didn't come and see me sooner.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You know who I am?

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Nobody sticks a finger into a bowling ball in this town without Miles Kastle knowing about it. You don't mind if I have a word with Theo, do you bunny? Kastle takes Theo by the elbow and pulls him away.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: I heard you've been having a little trouble with the Congress.  Theo pulls his eyes off Sheila. Kastle walks Theo past pairs of bowlers.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You might say I'm at the top of their shit list.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Maybe I can help you.  Try a lighter ball, Penelope - you'll get hurt with that big ball, honey.  I've seen tapes of you bowling on the circuit. You got Fazeli blood running through you. Your pop was a genuine talent in his day.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What's with the bad air between you two, Mr. Kastle?

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: It's nothing, just a slight business imbalance.  How's Gloria's thumb?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That's some pinfall. Almost a 133 average. Her ball's flat, she needs to work on her spin control.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: That's right, didn't you have a slight control problem in a recent tournament,champ?  Now go take out your "big four", darling.  Come on, we're making her nervous.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Think of this business like a big aquarium. You gotta have some sharks to eat the dirt at the bottom so the guppies can swim free at the top.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Profits down there, philanthropy up here.  Besides, it beats the pants off bingo.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Nice set-up.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: If it springs a leak, it'll be because Buzz is making waves.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What if he wants to get out?

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: He's earned an early retirement.  But enough about losers; Buzz Fazeli is history. Lets talk about your future.  I wanna show you something.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Rac. R-A-C. Renovate, Automate, Computerize. That, my boy, is the future. One of the monitors shows a little girl bowling. Her ball moves so slowly it barely tips over the first pin. Kastle hits a key and the pins explode in an emphatic strike. The little girl jumps with joy.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What ever happened to just bowling?

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: There's a lot of competition for amusement out there. You gotta adapt to survive.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I like the sport the way it is.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: A guy like you could breathe some fire into bowling. You got ambition like a...like a...blowtorch. You go for what you want and anything that gets in your way - PSSSHHT! -  shish kebabs.  Maybe lady fate washed you up on my doorstep for your own good.  I think I could help you, Theo.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: How Mr. Kastle?

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: You need a sponsor; I have influence. I could sponsor you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Why would you help me?

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: I like you, Theo. You bowl with soul.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You already have a partner Mr. Kastle. Sheila walks over as the sleazeballs' car pulls out of the driveway.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: I think Buzz is retiring soon. In fact, I think he's retiring tonight. Kastle pulls out a shiny gold credit card and holds it in front of Sheila.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Where's Junior?

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: He killed your stoolie embezzler father, and he's gonna kill you next! Sid and Breeze push him towards the van as the crowd's MURMUR increases. Kastle turns and yells over his shoulder.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Dad, this is ridiculous. Just open it.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Ssssh! Now real quiet. On three. One...two...three!

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: I bet you didn't know that you and Junior have something in common, Theo: Junior can't bowl anymore either. Isn't that right Junior? Kastle SLAMS the ketchup bottle down on Junior's right hand. The table settings jump from the shock. Junior sits impassively, his face a blank.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: See! No feeling. Tell Theo what happened to your hand, Junior.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: After we eat, Dad.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: He stuck it in the ball return machine when he was a kid. Crushed all the nerve endings. Junior starts stroking the ketchup bottle with his dead hand.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: You're just like you mother! Always jealous!

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: That's why Mom ran away, because you had to control everything!

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: She ran away to be with that...  that Motocross champion.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You're using Theo for your own deviant purposes!

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Look who's talking!

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Leave him alone!

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Just because your mother signed part ownership of the lanes over to you, doesn't mean you have a right to tell me how to run my business! I can have my lawyers take that deed away from you like that.  Sheila and Kastle sit up.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Fantastic! What talent.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You still got the touch Junior.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Don't go near the bowling alley.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Bowling "Center"!

turns.speaker: MRS. JACKSON
turns.text: Hello, Mr.Kastle.

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Hello, Violet. How's my favorite 'bowlerina' doing?

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: You keep that up Carmelita and one day you'll be a champion just like Mr. Skinner here. What do you think, Theo? Think Carmelita's got the stuff?

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: I get them while they're young. Builds loyalty.

turns.speaker: MRS. JACKSON
turns.text: She hit it, Mr. Kastle!

turns.speaker: KASTLE
turns.text: Four or five years when a girl like that's bowling on the pro tour for Team Kastle, she'll pay a handsome profit on my investment.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I just hold it loosely with both hands?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: That's right, sugar, find the grip that's right for you. Then grasp firmly. The camera weaves past a five foot pink whale with a gaping green mouth leading onto a mini-green.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Grasp firmly. Then what?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Line up where you want it.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Now swing it out a little to the right...

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Like this?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: No, no, that's too far. Try a more gentle stroke. It's all in the stroke. Go ahead, now, honey - stroke. As the camera comes around the side of the whale, we see an elderly man in a fire hydrant red sports coat and white slacks hunched over a diminutive fiftyish woman.  His back is to the camera and he is wearing a baseball cap with a plastic halo attached to it.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Strokin'. Here goes nothin'.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Hole in one! You're the queen of stroke!

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Yippy!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Is Mr. Fazeli in please?

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: Who wants to know?  Zeus!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm a bowler.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: I'm sick of you people. Why don't you leave him be?

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: Get that outta your mouth!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: They suspended me.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: He's not here.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm sorry about Zeus, Millie.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: This is a sign! Someone's coming to take Buzz away from me. I don't know if you're the guy or what, but I'm not letting it happen. I'm leaving him first.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I couldn't kill Buzz. I need his help. Theo helps Millie load suitcases into the trunk of her car.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: Buzz Fazeli never helps anybody but himself.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: He's my father, Millie.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: He's no father to you.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: Careful with that one. He won't tell me anything, but I know there's something strange going on over at the lanes. If you ask me, I'd say the old fart wants to die.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Where can I find him?

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: The Peter Pan.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What's your specialty?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Whips...orange whips.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Then I'll have the number four with one of your finest whips.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: How do you want it?  The eggs.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Uh...over easy.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Coming right up.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Do those two work for your dad or mine?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Mine, and they never tip.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Do you know where they're taking him?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Yeah, Babylon. Buzz runs the lanes there for my dad. Everybody who has anything to do with bowling in this town answers to my dad. Theo splits.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Here Theo, it's the Fazeli specialty; a seven-ten split. Theo looks down the lane and sees the two pins standing.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm not here to - I can't...

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I came here to have a word with your dad.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: What do you want with my dad?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Business.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Won't your father help you with that?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Having a legend for a dad isn't all it's cracked up to be.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Your dad's one of the only nice people in this fucking town. My Dad is slime. Kastle walks over. Theo stands up and shakes Kastle's proffered hand.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: This is a vicious cycle.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I think that a motorbike is one of the last really free things that people can do.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Isn't this technically a scooter?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: When I'm on my bike I feel like a wild person.  Better than any sex I've ever had.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Kinda tough on the butt.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Everything has it's drawbacks.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Where did your brother escape from?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: The mental hospital.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What does he do?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: He follows me, he tries to have sex with me, and then they send him to the nut-hut for a while and then he gets out and then he follows me, he tries to have sex with me, they send him to the nut-hut for a while...

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Whoa.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: It's a vicious cycle.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Mind if I cut in?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: No, not at all.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You and your sideburns are the talk of the party, Theo.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: The ladies in Akron call them thigh- ticklers.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Can I ask you something personal?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'd rather you didn't.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Do you have a girlfriend?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Not while I'm in training.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Do you have a boyfriend?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: No. Do You?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: No. Not at the present.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: So this brother of yours is hazardous to the health of your dates?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Nobody in this town really understands Junior. When I went to family sessions for him I realized he was the sanest one in the family. Actually, he's the only one in this whole fucking town who knows exactly who he is and what he wants.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Unfortunately what he wants is you.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: So, what about you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Do I want you?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: We'll get into that later.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Theo, what would you do if you couldn't bowl?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't know. It's all I ever wanted to do.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I wanted to be a motocross champion. My folks didn't really care what I did. Then Junior blew a fuse and I became their last hope. Most girls get ballet stuffed down their throats, I got bowling. I never understood how anyone could take it so seriously. I hope I'm not insulting you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: No, I'm fascinated.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Why were you suspended?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I used to be kind of wild. They used to call me the bad boy of bowling.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: So you're hoping Buzz can get you re- instated?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Well, that was plan A.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: What's plan B?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Plan B is your dad.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: What do you think my dad's gonna do for you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: He said he'd sponsor me.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Ha! And what do you have to do for him?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Oh really? Nothing? My dad doesn't do anything unless there's something in it for him.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: He asked me to keep an eye on you for a couple of days.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: What? Be my body guard?  Here's my body, Theo. Guard it. For my dad's sake. For your career. Sheila starts to unbutton her bowling shirt.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Sheila, please.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Come on Theo, what about plan C?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What's plan C?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Plan C...  ...is me.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I don't think your new outfit suits you, Theo.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Really? I kinda like it.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Do you talk with your mom?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It's been awhile. She didn't want me looking for my dad.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: My mom told me not to stay in this town.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: So why do you stay?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I'm a credit card junkie. I went on a binge and my dad bailed me out. Now I'm trapped in his easy payment plan.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I bet you get to meet a lot of eligible bowlers.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Yeah, but they're all little wannabes. I'm looking for a professional man.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I may not be a pro bowler, but I'm no amateur man. Sheila moves closer to Theo.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: How much would you charge me for the lips?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: More than you could afford.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Come on, bargain with me.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I could let them go for ten.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You professional men drive a hard bargain. I'm afraid I only have five on me. Sheila pulls out a 5 dollar bill.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: If you want a professional man, you have to be willing to pay for him.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What are you going to do about your brother?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You're here.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What about the guy he put in the body cast?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Then it's true, isn't it? About...

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: ...lane six. Yes.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: It wouldn't bother you if Buzz was in danger, would it?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Nope, I couldn't care less.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I'm sure you wouldn't care if he needed your help, right?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Why should I help that old fuck.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Yeah, what did Buzz Fazeli ever do for you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Zip.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: And besides, it's probably too late, anyhow.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Way too late. Buzz Fazeli is history.  Too late for what?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Too late for what, Sheila?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You know how people with broken bones know when there's a storm coming?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You got any broken bones?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: No, but something's gonna blow in this town. I can feel it.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Are you fucking with me Sheila? Is something gonna happen to Buzz? Sheila seems to be trying to tell Theo, but is unable.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I can't tell you, Theo.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I saw your eyes when you hit that guy with your ball on TV. THUNDER rumbles. Theo takes Sheila by the shoulders.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Tell me, Sheila. What are you afraid of? Sheila shakes her head.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I'm afraid you'll hurt him.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It's Junior, isn't it.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I can't - I can't do it.  He's my brother.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: He's my father.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: These open the back door. Don't let him catch you behind the machines; if he does, you're trapped. I'll meet you at the bridge. Theo takes the keys. Sheila grabs his arm.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You don't have to do this. We could just cut out of here, go to Akron,  or anywhere else.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'll be at the bridge.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You told Junior that we did it.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: It?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It. Bouncy-bouncy. Fucked. He tried to squeeze my fucking head off. What did you say to him? When they reach each other, they stop. Sheila seems to weigh her answer.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I told him you were my boyfriend.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What the hell did you go doing that for Sheila? We haven't even gotten naked yet!

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: We would have sooner or later.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Oh great! He tried to kill me! You knew he would go off if he thought I fooled around with you.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Did you - kill him?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: How do you get this thing down?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Tell me what happened Theo.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You wanted me to kill him, didn't you?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: If he's not dead, he'll keep coming back.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: He's dead Sheila.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I feel sick.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You should.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Are you sure he's dead?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I didn't stop to take his pulse.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I think your brother may have already gotten to Buzz. He gets into his car.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Can I come with you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I did your dirty work for you Sheila, now fuck off. Theo drives away leaving Sheila standing alone. She watches his car recede with a thoughtful expression, then turns on her heel.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Why did you come back?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: When I'm with you Sheila, I don't even think about bowling. Theo takes Sheila in his arms and kisses her passionately. She stops him and looks around nervously.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: If Junior finds us, he'll kill us both.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I killed him once, I'll just have to kill him again.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You don't get two chances with Junior.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: At least I'll die smiling.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Say something, Theo. Give me something. A doll's legs catch fire. Theo stares into Sheila's eyes.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Plan C. From now on it's gonna be plan C. Both bodies throb and grind, their sandy hands sliding over each others' sweaty skin.
